dk.pervasive.jcaf.entity
Class GenericEntity

java.lang.Object
  dk.pervasive.jcaf.item.AbstractContextItem
      dk.pervasive.jcaf.entity.GenericEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContextItem, Entity, EntityConfig, EntityListener, XMLSerializable, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Person, Place
public class GenericEntity
extends AbstractContextItem
implements Entity, EntityConfig, ContextItem

Defines a generic entity.

GenericEntity implements the Entity and EntityConfig interfaces. GenericEntity can be directly extended by a entity.

GenericEntity makes writing entities easier. It provides simple versions of the lifecycle methods init and destroy and of the methods in the EntityConfig interface. GenericEntity also implements the log method, declared in the EntityEnvironment interface.

To write a specific entity, you need only override the abstract contextChanged() method.

Note that when you fetch a GenericEntity over RMI, you get a handle back to its server through the getContextService() method. The getContext() method uses this to fetch the latest context information from the server.

Author:
Jakob Bardram
See Also:
